p: Another basic NPM isolated from marine algae is chlorophyll, which is a tetrapyrrole and greenish lipid soluble pigment. Generally, there are four major categories of chlorophylls found in marine algae: chlorophyll a, b, c, and d [ 47, 48]. Chlorophyll pigments and their derivatives have cancer protective and anti-mutagenic effects [ 47] and may be taken into consideration for replacing the synthetic pigments that are used in the food industry [ 57].
